item.title: Board work session gives new supt, members look at OKCPS health
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The Oklahoma City Public Schools Board of Education work session Tuesday was packed with presentations to bring board members up to date and to brief newly-hired Superintendent Sean McDaniel. *See updated information below that was added the next day after publication. These are notes taken as the meeting progressed. They are sketch notes taken during […]

item.title: OKCPS Board of Ed chooses new superintendent from metro
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The Oklahoma City Public Schools Board of Education hired Dr. Sean McDaniel, 55, Tuesday night as their next superintendent with a 5-2 vote. All board members were present except for south-side member Gloria Torres. And in a news conference just after the OKCPS board vote, he showed a depth of experience in dealing with different […]

The post OKCPS Board of Ed chooses new superintendent from metro appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Work session covers intervention strategy, gifted-talented program
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The Oklahoma City Public Schools Board of Education met for a work session Monday to discuss its intervention strategy and the Gifted/Talented program. The following are sketch notes taken during the flow of the meeting. Slide deck PDFs are embedded at the end to more adequately fill in some details. Board went into executive session […]

item.title: OKCPS board work session clarifies superintendent search
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Oklahoma City Public Schools Board of Education members met Monday in a work session with Oklahoma State School Boards Association staff to define what they want in the next superintendent. Gloria Torres was the only member not in attendance due to being out of the country. Process Members processed what they thought a successful district […]

The post OKCPS board work session clarifies superintendent search appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Teachers, board settle OKCPS negotiated agreement in record time
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
At least two decades of ugly tradition in Oklahoma City Public Schools was broken when the Board of Education approved the 2018-2019 negotiated agreement with its teachers March 5. Over the last 25+ years, the district and its teachers’ union has come to a negotiated agreement no earlier than mid-summer and typically as late as […]

The post Teachers, board settle OKCPS negotiated agreement in record time appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: OKCPS Board highlights – remediation, Native Amer focused charter, teacher survey
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
These are highlights of the regular meeting of the Oklahoma City Public Schools Board of Education Monday, Nov. 13. Remediation Chief Academic Officer Lynn Barnes gave a report on the further development of remediation frameworks for teachers so there will be a uniform approach in the district to remediation. Board members took considerable time asking […]

item.title: Parents, students fear NE High Sch principal may be fired
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The big question among students and parents Wednesday morning was “Where is Ms. Starr?” Sue Starr is the popular principal of Northeast High School in Oklahoma City Public Schools on the east side of Oklahoma City. But parents, teachers and students fear district administration may be trying to fire her. The district has now partially […]

The post Parents, students fear NE High Sch principal may be fired appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: OKCPS confirms 42 schools affected by forced teacher transfers
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Oklahoma City Public Schools confirms that 42 schools will be affected by forced teacher transfers to achieve what the district calls “rebalancing.” According to district spokesperson Beth Harrison, rebalancing is done to even out the ratios of teachers to students in each school. Transfers will take effect Oct. 23, the day students return from Fall […]

The post OKCPS confirms 42 schools affected by forced teacher transfers appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: No school closures, but “tough choices” this year says OKCPS supt
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Oklahoma City Public Schools Superintendent Aurora Lora has decided not to close any schools this school year, 2017-2018 according to a statement released to Free Press late Friday afternoon. She does believe that there are “tough choices” to be made this year about teacher assignments because of schools that are “significantly under-enrolled.” Lora also wants […]

The post No school closures, but “tough choices” this year says OKCPS supt appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Fight is on! OKCPS to sue state
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
What happened Thursday may be a sign of things to come over the next year. Oklahoma City Public Schools leaders announced in a news conference Thursday that they intend to sue the State of Oklahoma’s Legislature because of what they view as unconstitutionally low funding. Not long after, House Speaker Charles McCall issued a stern […]

The post Fight is on! OKCPS to sue state appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.
